summary: This is an email from November 30, 2018, forwarding a summary of a 2011 legal proceeding where Jeffrey Epstein petitioned to have his sex offender status reduced in New York. A New York prosecutor argued on Epstein's behalf, but the judge denied the petition, expressing astonishment at the prosecutor's actions.

keyFacts: In 2011, Jeffrey Epstein petitioned to reduce his New York sex offender status from level 3 (highest risk).
A New York County District Attorney's prosecutor argued on Epstein's behalf, citing that the Florida case never led to an indictment and that victims failed to cooperate.
New York Supreme Court Judge Ruth Shillingford denied the petition, expressing astonishment that a prosecutor would make such a request for a serial sex offender.
Epstein was required to register as a sex offender in New York every 90 days due to his home there.
The document is an email from November 30, 2018, forwarding information from a Miami Herald article about the 2011 proceeding.
